episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' features discussions on Nazi comedians during WWII, the quirky team names of the Philippines Basketball Association, the behavior of drunk zebrafish, and the surprising overlap in timelines between woolly mammoths and Egyptian pharaohs.

facts.fact: During the Second World War, the Nazis employed two official Nazi comedians.

The Philippines Basketball Association, which is the second oldest in the world after the NBA, have 10 teams in total, and their names include The Rain and Shine Elasto Painters, The San Miguel Beer Men, and Talk and Text, Troopang Textors.
If you get a zebrafish drunk and put him in a tank with other zebrafish, the sober ones will follow him around.
The youngest woolly mammoths are older than the oldest Egyptian pharaohs.
